Name: Amulet in the form of a serpent
Description: This object in cornaline, with an attachment, takes the form of the upper part of a serpent, also designated by the "half-serpent". Serving as an amulet, it protected the owner against all bites from serpents. The front side of the piece bears a short inscription which is difficult to read, but which probably mentions the name (and the title) of the owner.
